member.summary: The query is awaiting for rate limits

member.name: E:Tweetinvi.Core.Events.IExternalClientEvents.BeforeWaitingForRequestRateLimits
member.summary: This is the first event raised. This event is raised before executing a request when the rate limits for the query have been retrieved. At that stage you have the information regarding how many requests can be performed and how long you have to wait if no more request are available. This event will let you log, modify, cancel a request. Use this event if you wish to manually handle rate limits

member.name: E:Tweetinvi.Core.Events.IExternalClientEvents.BeforeExecutingRequest
member.summary: Event raised before executing a request. At that stage we have waited for rate limits to be available. The request will be executed right after this event.

member.name: E:Tweetinvi.Core.Events.IExternalClientEvents.AfterExecutingRequest
member.summary: Event raised after a request has been performed, this event will let you log the query and check the result/exception.

member.summary:
Inform the user that the stream is not read fast enough and that if this continues, the stream will be disconnected when the buffered queue is full.
The StallWarning parameter needs to be set to true for this event to be raised.

member.name: M:Tweetinvi.Client.ITimelinesClient.GetHomeTimelineAsync(Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetHomeTimelineParameters)
member.summary:
Returns a collection of the most recent Tweets and Retweets posted by the authenticated user and the users they follow. The home timeline is central to how most users interact with the Twitter service.
Up to 800 Tweets are obtainable on the home timeline. It is more volatile for users that follow many users or follow users who Tweet frequently.
member.returns: List the of tweets displayed on the authenticated user's home page

member.returns: An iterator to list the of tweets displayed on the authenticated user's home page

Up to 800 Tweets are obtainable on the home timeline. It is more volatile for users that follow many users or follow users who Tweet frequently.

summary.para: If a header with the same name was generated by Tweetinvi, its value will be overriden by the custom header value
If no header with the custom header name was generated by Tweetinvi, the header will be created
If a header with the same name was generated by Tweetinvi, the value will be added to the list of the header values
If no header with the custom header name was generated by Tweetinvi, the header will be created

member.summary: List of unique identifiers of polls present in the Tweets returned. These are returned as a string in order to avoid complications with languages and tools that cannot handle large integers.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetEntitiesV2.Annotations
member.summary:
Entities are comprised of people, places, products, and organizations. Entities are delivered as part of the entity payload section. They are programmatically assigned based on what is explicitly mentioned in the Tweet text.
Read more: https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-api/annotations

member.name: T:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2
member.summary:
A Tweet
Read more here : https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-api/data-dictionary/object-model/tweet

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.Attachments
member.summary: Specifies the type of attachments (if any) present in this Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.AuthorId
member.summary: The unique identifier of the User who posted this Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.ContextAnnotations
member.summary:
Contains context annotations for the Tweet.
Derived from the analysis of a Tweets text and will include a domain and entity pairing which can be used to discover Tweets on topics that may have been previously difficult to surface. At present, were using a list of 50+ domains to categorize Tweets.
Read more: https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-api/annotations

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.ConversationId
member.summary: The Tweet ID of the original Tweet of the conversation (which includes direct replies, replies of replies).

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.CreatedAt
member.summary: Creation time of the Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.Entities
member.summary: Entities which have been parsed out of the text of the Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.Geo
member.summary: Contains details about the location tagged by the user in this Tweet, if they specified one.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.Id
member.summary: The unique identifier of the requested Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.InReplyToUserId
member.summary: If the represented Tweet is a reply, this field will contain the original Tweets author ID. This will not necessarily always be the user directly mentioned in the Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.Lang
member.summary: Language of the Tweet, if detected by Twitter. Returned as a BCP47 language tag.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.PossiblySensitive
member.summary: This field only surfaces when a Tweet contains a link. The meaning of the field doesnt pertain to the Tweet content itself, but instead it is an indicator that the URL contained in the Tweet may contain content or media identified as sensitive content.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.ReferencedTweets
member.summary: A list of Tweets this Tweet refers to. For example, if the parent Tweet is a Retweet, a Retweet with comment (also known as Quoted Tweet) or a Reply, it will include the related Tweet referenced to by its parent.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.Source
member.summary: The name of the app the user Tweeted from.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.Text
member.summary: The actual UTF-8 text of the Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Models.V2.TweetV2.Withheld
member.summary:
When present, contains withholding details for withheld content.
Read more: https://help.twitter.com/en/rules-and-policies/tweet-withheld-by-country

member.summary: Non-public engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.

member.summary: Engagement metrics, tracked in an organic context, for the Tweet at the time of the request.

member.summary: Engagement metrics, tracked in a promoted context, for the Tweet at the time of the request.

member.summary: The name of the user, as theyve defined it on their profile. Not necessarily a persons name.

member.summary: Unique identifier of this user's pinned Tweet.

member.summary: The URL to the profile image for this user, as shown on the user's profile.

member.summary: Indicates if this user has chosen to protect their Tweets (in other words, if this user's Tweets are private).

member.summary: The URL specified in the user's profile, if present.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IUpdateAccountSettingsParameters.DisplayLanguage
member.summary:
The languages which Twitter should use for this user.
PLEASE MAKE SURE this is a Language from the DisplayLanguages list
You can use a Language.IsADisplayLanguage() extension function to ensure it is supported Tweetinvi will not prevent this parameter to set to any Language for future support

member.summary: When enabled sleep time is the time when push or SMS notifications should not be sent to the user.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IUpdateAccountSettingsParameters.StartSleepHour
member.summary: The hour that sleep time should begin if it is enabled. The value for this parameter should be provided in ISO8601 format (i.e. 00-23). The time is considered to be in the same timezone as the users time_zone setting.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IUpdateAccountSettingsParameters.EndSleepHour
member.summary: The hour that sleep time should end if it is enabled. The value for this parameter should be provided in ISO8601 format (i.e. 00-23). The time is considered to be in the same timezone as the users time_zone setting.

member.name: M:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IUpdateAccountSettingsParameters.SetTimeZone(Tweetinvi.Models.TimeZoneFromTwitter)
member.summary: The timezone dates and times should be displayed in for the user. The timezone must be one of the Rails TimeZone names.

It means that if there are a total of 100 tweets, and the latest are 80 new tweets and 20 retweets. If the MaximumResultSet is set to 100, you will receive 80 tweets and not 100 even if there is more than 80 new tweets in the Timeline.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetOEmbedTweetParameters.MaxWidth
member.summary:
The maximum width of a rendered Tweet in whole pixels. A supplied value under or over the allowed range will be returned as the minimum or maximum supported width respectively; the reset width value will be reflected in the returned width property.
Min: 220; Max: 550

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetOEmbedTweetParameters.HideMedia
member.summary: When set to true links in a Tweet are not expanded to photo, video, or link previews.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetOEmbedTweetParameters.HideThread
member.summary: When set to true a collapsed version of the previous Tweet in a conversation thread will not be displayed when the requested Tweet is in reply to another Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetOEmbedTweetParameters.OmitScript
member.summary: When set to true the script responsible for loading widgets.js will not be returned. Your webpages should include their own reference to widgets.js for use across all Twitter widgets including Embedded Tweets.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetOEmbedTweetParameters.Alignment
member.summary: Specifies whether the embedded Tweet should be floated left, right, or center in the page relative to the parent element.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetOEmbedTweetParameters.RelatedUsernames
member.summary: A list of Twitter usernames related to your content. This value will be forwarded to Tweet action intents if a viewer chooses to reply, like, or retweet the embedded Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetOEmbedTweetParameters.Language
member.summary:
Request returned HTML and a rendered Tweet in the specified Twitter language supported by embedded Tweets.
https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-for-websites/twitter-for-websites-supported-languages/overview

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetOEmbedTweetParameters.Theme
member.summary: When set to dark, the Tweet is displayed with light text over a dark background.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetOEmbedTweetParameters.LinkColor
member.summary: Adjust the color of Tweet text links with a hexadecimal color value.

member.summary: Set to video to return a Twitter Video embed for the given Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IGetOEmbedTweetParameters.EnablePersonalisationAndSuggestions
member.summary: This is the `dnt` parameter. When set to true, the Tweet and its embedded page on your site are not used for purposes that include personalized suggestions and personalized ads.

member.summary: The ID of an existing status that the update is in reply to.

member.summary: Quote a specific tweet

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.InReplyToTweet
member.summary: An existing status that the update is in reply to.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.QuotedTweetUrl
member.summary: In order for a URL to not be counted in the status body of an extended Tweet, provide a URL as a Tweet attachment. This URL must be a Tweet permalink, or Direct Message deep link. Arbitrary, non-Twitter URLs must remain in the status text. URLs passed to the attachment_url parameter not matching either a Tweet permalink or Direct Message deep link will fail at Tweet creation and cause an exception.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.PlaceId
member.summary: A place in the world.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.Coordinates
member.summary: Coordinates indicating the position from where the tweet has been published.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.DisplayExactCoordinates
member.summary: Whether or not to put a pin on the exact coordinates a tweet has been sent from.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.MediaIds
member.summary: A list of media_ids to associate with the Tweet. You may include up to 4 photos or 1 animated GIF or 1 video in a Tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.Medias
member.summary: A list of media (uploaded or not) that need to be displayed within the tweet.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.HasMedia
member.summary: Whether this Tweet will be published with any media attached

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.PossiblySensitive
member.summary: If you upload Tweet media that might be considered sensitive content such as nudity, violence, or medical procedures, you should set this value to true.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.TrimUser
member.summary: If set to true, the creator property (IUser) will only contain the id.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.AutoPopulateReplyMetadata
member.summary: Twitter will auto-populate the @mentions in the extended tweet prefix from the Tweet being replied to, plus a mention of the screen name that posted the Tweet being replied to. i.e. This auto-populates a "reply all". Must be used with InReplyToTweetId or InReplyToTweet. Use ExcludeReplyUserIds to specify accounts to not mention in the prefix. Also note that there can be a maximum of 50 mentions in the prefix, any more will error.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.ExcludeReplyUserIds
member.summary: Twitter User IDs to not include in the auto-populated extended Tweet prefix. Cannot exclude the User who is directly being replied to, only the additional mentions. Must be used with AutoPopulateReplyMetadata.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IPublishTweetParameters.CardUri
member.summary: Associate an ads card with the Tweet using the card_uri value from any ads card response.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.Parameters.IUploadOptionalParameters.WaitForTwitterProcessing
member.summary: When an upload completes Twitter takes few seconds to process the media and confirm that it is a media that can be used on the platform. With WaitForTwitterProcessing enabled, Tweetinvi will wait for Twitter to confirm that the media has been successfully processed.

member.name: T:Tweetinvi.RateLimitTrackerMode
member.summary: Provide a set of preconfigured solutions that you can use to track the Twitter rate limits.

member.name: F:Tweetinvi.RateLimitTrackerMode.None
member.summary: By default Tweetinvi let you handle the RateLimits on your own

member.name: F:Tweetinvi.RateLimitTrackerMode.TrackAndAwait
member.summary: This option will track the actions performed and update the internal RateLimits. If not enought RateLimits are available to perform the query, the current thread will await for the RateLimits to be available before continuing its process.

member.name: F:Tweetinvi.RateLimitTrackerMode.TrackOnly
member.summary: This option will only track the actions performed and update the internal RateLimits. This option won't pause a thread if you do not have enough RateLimits to perform a query.

member.name: T:Tweetinvi.TweetMode
member.summary: Specify whether you want your tweet to use Twitter extended mode.

member.summary: Proxy used to execute Http Requests.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.ITweetinviSettings.HttpRequestTimeout
member.summary: Http Requests Timeout duration in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.ITweetinviSettings.RateLimitTrackerMode
member.summary: Solution used to track the RateLimits.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.ITweetinviSettings.RateLimitWaitFudge
member.summary: How much additional time to wait than should be strictly necessary for a new batch of Twitter rate limits to be available. Required to account for timing discrepancies both within Twitter's servers and between Twitter and us.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.ITweetinviSettings.TweetMode
member.summary: Specify whether you want your tweet to use the extended mode.

member.name: P:Tweetinvi.ITweetinviSettings.GetUtcDateTime

member.summary: DEFAULT : User receives messages from himself and followers. (Twitter home timeline behavior)

member.summary: User receives messages that are related to himself exclusively.
